Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient wishes to explore feelings of guilt related to their inability to assist everyone in their community.
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient has been practicing mindfulness techniques, which have helped reduce anxiety and improve their ability to manage overwhelming thoughts. They have applied these techniques in stressful situations, such as a recent presentation, which boosted their confidence.
Psychosocial History: The patient feels a stronger connection with their community and family, emphasizing the importance of open communication and understanding in their relationships.
Mental Health Observations: The patient describes feeling lighter and more at ease when practicing mindfulness, indicating positive mental health progress.
Current Functional Status: The patient reports successful engagement in community activities and improved family dynamics, reflecting a positive shift in their functional status.
Progress Evaluation: The patient shows significant progress in managing anxiety and improving relationships through mindfulness and open communication.
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient plans to continue practicing active listening and expressing feelings honestly to nurture openness in relationships.
Next Steps: The patient wishes to focus on managing feelings of guilt in future sessions.
